intro: Thesium nutans, commonly known as the nodding thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often drooping downward. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Thesium nutans is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
